net.sf.mmm.search.engine.base

Class AbstractSearchQueryBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableObject
      • net.sf.mmm.search.engine.base.AbstractSearchQueryBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SearchQueryBuilder, Refreshable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LuceneSearchQueryBuilder

    public abstract class AbstractSearchQueryBuilder
extends AbstractLoggableObject
implements SearchQueryBuilder
    This is the abstract base implementation of the SearchQueryBuilder interface.
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

        The separator of minimum and maximum in a range query. Has to be separated with whitespaces.

      • parseStandardQuery

        public SearchQuery parseStandardQuery(String query)
                               throws SearchException
        This method parses the given query string in the standard query language of this specification.
        Specified by:
        parseStandardQuery in interface SearchQueryBuilder
        Parameters:
        query - is the query to parse as string.
        Returns:
        the parsed query.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the given query string is illegal and can NOT be parsed. Implementations should be tolerant and try to avoid this situation.
        See Also:
        SearchQueryBuilder.parseStandardQuery(String, SearchQueryBuilderOptions)

      • parseStandardQuery

        private SearchQuery parseStandardQuery(CharSequenceScanner parser,
                                       SearchQueryBuilderOptions options,
                                       String defaultProperty,
                                       int depth)
        Parameters:
        parser - is the scanner of the query-string.
        options - are the SearchQueryBuilderOptions.
        defaultProperty - is the property to use as default for unqualified search-terms.
        depth - is the depth of the query expression (number of open parenthesis).
        Returns:
        the parsed query or null if this a call with a depth greater than 0 and the parsed query segment was void.
        See Also:
        parseStandardQuery(String, SearchQueryBuilderOptions)

      • parseStandardClause

                                        String defaultField,
                                        int depth,
                                        SearchQueryBuilderOptions options)
        Parameters:
        parser - is the scanner of the query-string.
        defaultField - is the field to use as default for unqualified search-terms.
        depth - is the depth of the query expression (number of open parenthesis).
        options - are the SearchQueryBuilderOptions.
        Returns:
        the parsed query or null if the parsed query segment was void.

      • parseStandardQuery

        public SearchQuery parseStandardQuery(String query,
                                      SearchQueryBuilderOptions options)
        This method parses the given query string in the standard query language of this specification.
        The standard query language is defined by the following EBNF grammar: 
         <WHITESPACE> = (' '|'\t'|'\n'|'\r')
 <WHITESPACES> = (<WHITESPACE>)+
 <START_CHAR> = ^(<WHITESPACE>|'+'|'-'|'('|')'|'"'|'\'')
 <CHAR> = (<START_CHAR>|'+'|'-')
 <WORD> = <START_CHAR> (<CHAR>)*
 <PHRASE> = '"' (^('"'))* '"'
 <TO> = ("TO" | "to" | "-")
 <MIN> = <WORD>
 <MAX> = <WORD>
 <RANGE> = ('{' | '[') <MIN> ' ' <TO> ' ' <MAX> (']' | '}')
 <MATCH> = (<PHRASE> | <WORD> | <RANGE>)
 <FIELD> = ('a'-'z'|'A'-'Z')+
 <CLAUSE> = ['+'|'-'] [<FIELD> ':'] ( <MATCH> | '(' <QUERY> ')' )
 <QUERY> = <CLAUSE> | <CLAUSE> (<WHITESPACES> <QUERY>)* )
        Specified by:
        parseStandardQuery in interface SearchQueryBuilder
        Parameters:
        query - is the query to parse as string.
        options - are the SearchQueryBuilderOptions.
        Returns:
        the parsed query.
